Those who drink red wine often find that there is inevitable staining to their teeth. Your tooth enamel absorbs the dark color of the wine, which makes them appear darker. The only way to resolve this issue is to cut back on the amount of red wine you drink.

Drinking plenty of water is always a good idea, but it has additional benefits for you if you're trying to whiten your teeth. When you drink water, your teeth get a good rinsing and are less likely to stain. Try to drink throughout the day and while you are eating.

Interestingly, brushing with strawberry juice can make your teeth look their whitest. The acid in the juice softens the enamel, allowing for easy removal of stains. This is a cheap way to get a white smile.

Speak with your dentist about getting a gel for home use that whitens teeth Your dentist should give you a mouthpiece that will be filled with gel. You want to wear this for a couple of hours every night for 2-3 weeks. This method can lighten your teeth by up to eight shades.

You probably have a product in your own yard that can help with tooth whitening. The bark of a walnut tree is amazing at reducing tooth discoloration. Strip a piece of walnut tree bark off a tree, clean it and then rub it over your teeth immediately before brushing with toothpaste. This helps remove plaque and stains.

If you mix some lemon juice and table salt into a paste, brush teeth normally using a little bit of the paste you made. If you find you have salt sensitive teeth, then you should stop using this mixture.

If you're pregnant, you should never use any type of teeth whitening products. The chemicals that they contain may hurt your unborn child. Certain whitening toothpastes can be an exception to this rule. However, you should always ask your doctor prior to using them to ensure they are safe to use.

Whitening gels are an option to get whiter teeth. You can buy these products in drug stores or pharmacies and they are more affordable than a professional whitening solution. If you have teeth that are very discolored though, a trip to the dentist might be your only option.

Add more dairies to your diet. Milk, cheese and yogurt all have nutrients that lend to creation of strong and healthy teeth. These minerals also help to strengthen the enamel, which means they are less sensitive to foods and many other things that would normally cause your teeth to get discolored. Therefore, if you eat these kinds of foods, your smile will be whiter.

There is no arguing with the fact that whiter teeth make you look and feel better. Using the effective advice above will provide you with whiter teeth and a more confident you to show the world. Sparkling white teeth are not out of your reach.

Easy Ways To Ensure Your Dental Health - Products That Protect

Keeping your gums and teeth healthy takes maintenance and the right products can help. There are many things you can do to help keep your teeth as healthy as possible in between dental visits. You can buy many products at your local pharmacy, natural foods store as well as online that are made to keep your teeth and gums in good condition. We'll now share with you a few economical products that can help you keep your teeth healthy.

Your toothbrush is the most basic tool available for teeth care. This is something that every person needs to have...unless they opt for the alternative version; the Peelu stick. Toothbrushes are available just about everywhere from your local supermarket to the internet--even airports sell them. Choosing the best toothbrush is mostly based on personal choice but finding one that fits well into your mouth is also important. You should also choose between soft, medium and hard bristled brushes. Most dentists today suggest using a toothbrush with medium or soft bristles, as hard bristles can be too harsh and damage the enamel on your teeth. There are also toothbrushes with extra-soft bristles for people who suffer from extra sensitive teeth or who have recently underwent dental surgery. In addition to modern dental care products, you can also find traditional tools and remedies for your teeth. You can find certain items, for example, that are used by millions of people around the world, but that aren't well known in North America or Europe. One plant that's still used throughout India for mouth care is Neem, and its leaves and oils have properties that prevent tooth and gum problems. Gum disease is a widespread problem today, and one of the best remedies for this is Neem oil. Another herb that's very good for your gums is echinacea, and this is one that many people who shop in health food stores are familiar with. Many plants and herbs have a healing effect on dental problems, so this is an avenue well worth exploring.

There's one type of tree that's famous in the Middle East and India for being highly beneficial for the teeth -Peelu. While chewing gum is not usually recommended for keeping your teeth healthy, one exception to this is Peelu gum. A commonly used item in the Middle East and India is the Miswak, or Peelu stick; these have been used for centuries as toothbrushes. There's evidence that it's better to use a Peelu stick than a toothbrush to keep your teeth clean. The fibers found on the Peelu stick have natural healing and cleaning properties, so if you use this toothpaste isn't needed. Peelu gum and Peelu sticks are very good for both your gums and teeth. So you may want to look for Peelu products, which can be found in natural food stores or online.

As you probably have guessed, tooth care products are to be used in between dental visits and are not a replacement for them. Your dental bills will also be much lower since you are potentially preventing any type of dental hygiene issues. Always be on the lookout for dental products that can improve your teeth and gums as new ones are released on the market each and every year.
